error.signature: CoreDNS: SERVFAIL for cluster.local, dial tcp: lookup on: no such host

verdict.summary: DNS resolution fails at the cluster level because CoreDNS is down, misconfigured, or blocked by NetworkPolicy.

dead_ends.action: Add custom /etc/hosts entries to all pods
dead_ends.why_fails: Doesn't scale — service IPs change and new services won't be resolvable

dead_ends.action: Restart all pods in the cluster
dead_ends.why_fails: If CoreDNS is the problem, restarting app pods won't fix DNS

workarounds.action: Check CoreDNS pod status and logs: kubectl get pods -n kube-system -l k8s-app=kube-dns
workarounds.how: kubectl logs -n kube-system -l k8s-app=kube-dns — look for upstream DNS failures or loop detection

workarounds.action: Check if NetworkPolicy blocks egress to kube-dns on port 53
workarounds.how: Ensure egress NetworkPolicy allows UDP/TCP port 53 to kube-system namespace

leads_to.condition: when application crashes because it can't resolve dependencies

frequently_confused_with.distinction: k8s-dns-resolution-failed covers cluster-level CoreDNS failures, while dns-resolution-failed-pod covers per-pod DNS issues
